title: Implement PNG rendering
intent: Create lsysviz/render.py with a function that renders a list of line segments to a PNG image file using Pillow.
forbidden: Do not modify any other existing files
Do not add any CLI logic
acceptance_commands: python -c "import tempfile, os; from lsysviz.types import Segment; from lsysviz.render import render_to_png; d = tempfile.mkdtemp(); p = os.path.join(d, 'test.png'); render_to_png([Segment(0,0,100,0), Segment(100,0,100,100)], 200, 200, p); assert os.path.isfile(p), 'PNG not created'"
notes: Define: render_to_png(segments: list[Segment], width: int, height: int, output_path: str) -> None. Create a white RGB image of the given dimensions using PIL/Pillow. Compute a bounding box of all segment coordinates, then scale and translate all segments to fit within the image with some padding (e.g. 10% margin on each side). Draw each segment as a black line (width 1). Save as PNG to output_path. If segments is empty, save a blank white image. The output must be deterministic: identical inputs must produce identical bytes. Pillow must be installed ('pip install Pillow'). Do NOT modify lsysviz/types.py.
